intro: Polianthes platyphylla, commonly known as the Mexican rain lily, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces strap-like, dark green leaves that are arranged in a fan shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Polianthes platyphylla is also known for its ability to produce offsets, which can be used for propagation.
